DOC.brief_title: Prevention of Renal Failure in Children With Urinary Tract Infections
DOC.detailed_description: The aim of the study is to describe the current clinical management of young children with urinary tract infections in Dutch primary care and also to describe the possibilities for improvement and potential cost-efficiency of improved care in the light of preventing renal failure. The 4 phases of the study contain the following questions: - Phase 1: What is the current clinical management of urinary tract infections in young children in primary care? - Phase 2: What are the possibilities for improving the clinical management of urinary tract infections and are these improvements practically achievable? - Phase 3: What is the cost-efficiency of the several interventions for improving clinical management of urinary tract infections - Phase 4: What is the influence of the intervention on clinical management?
DOC.criteria: children between 012 years of age with a proven urinary tract infection in general practice
